physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Patient experienced transient increase in blood pressure to 145/78 mmHg and a decrease in heart rate to 48 bpm after dexmedetomidine administration. During surgery, heart rate dropped into the 30s, leading to asystole.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The significant bradycardia progressed to asystole during surgical stimulation.
Heart rate dropped to the 30s leading to asystole shortly after sternal retraction, then returned to baseline following treatment.
